abandon.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for
abandon.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: How could she abandon her own child?
abandon.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to go away from a place, vehicle etc permanently, especially because the situation makes it impossible for you to stay
abandon.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We had to abandon the car and walk the rest of the way.
Fearing further attacks, most of the population had abandoned the city.
abandon.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to stop doing something because there are too many problems and it is impossible to continue
abandon.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The game had to be abandoned due to bad weather.
They abandoned their attempt to recapture the castle.
Because of the fog they abandoned their idea of driving.
abandon.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to stop having a particular idea, belief, or attitude
abandon.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: They were accused of abandoning their socialist principles.
Rescuers had abandoned all hope of finding any more survivors.
abandon.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if someone does something with abandon, they behave in a careless or uncontrolled way, without thinking or caring about what they are doing
abandon.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: They drank and smoked with reckless abandon.
abandon.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to stop doing or using something because it is too difficult or unsuccessful
abandon.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The company abandoned its takeover bid.
The power plant was abandoned before it was even completed.
abandon.translation[2].definitions[1].de: if you abandon a ship or its cargo, you accept that it is too badly damaged to be saved, and so give it up to an insurance company in exchange for an insurance payment
abandon.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to leave an organization because you believe that it is going to fail soon
abandon.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The chairman and most of the board members had already abandoned ship.
abandon.translation[2].definitions[3].de: to no longer continue with a legal case etc
abandon.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: They decided to abandon their claim for damages.
